channel.title: Posts on Open Justice Oklahoma Data Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Open Justice Oklahoma Data Blog

item.title: Data Deep Dive: Oklahoma County Detention Center
item.description: 1. The Oklahoma County Detention Center Located in Oklahoma City, the Oklahoma County Detention Center (OCDC) is the biggest jail in the state, currently incarcerating an average of around 1,500-1,600 people. It used to be much bigger – in 2016, the jail’s population peaked at over 2,500 people, X% the jail’s original intended capacity – but reform efforts undertaken in the last few years have successfully begun to reverse this upward trend.

item.title: Stat Spotlight: Homelessness in Local Jails
item.description: Data from the Oklahoma County Detention Center sheds light on the issue of homelessness among incarcerated people in Oklahoma.

item.title: A Fancy R Markdown Post
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Old Markdown Post
item.description: Posts can be plain Markdown as well.
